meanings.definition: To cause something to increase or decrease incrementally
meanings.sent1: She ratcheted up the volume on the radio to hear the music better.
meanings.sent2: The team ratcheted up their efforts to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent3: He ratcheted down the speed of the treadmill to avoid falling off.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room ratcheted up as the meeting went on.
meanings.sent5: The excitement ratcheted up as the countdown to the event began.

meanings.definition: To move in a series of steps or stages
meanings.sent1: The toy robot ratcheted across the floor, moving in a jerky manner.
meanings.sent2: The old car ratcheted along the bumpy road, making slow progress.
meanings.sent3: The caterpillar ratcheted its way up the branch, inch by inch.
meanings.sent4: The clock's hands ratcheted around, marking the passage of time.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's movements ratcheted gracefully across the stage.

meanings.definition: To tighten or secure with a ratchet mechanism
meanings.sent1: He ratcheted the bolts in place to secure the structure.
meanings.sent2: She ratcheted the straps tightly to keep the backpack from slipping.
meanings.sent3: The mechanic ratcheted the screws into position with precision.
meanings.sent4: The climber ratcheted the harness to ensure safety during the ascent.
meanings.sent5: The worker ratcheted the gears together to complete the machine.
